{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3311920,"name":"Brennan","username":"BMcT_Official","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmct_official/{size}/211427_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-17T22:04:47.987Z","cooked":"

Our team is having issues tuning our Falcon500 motors and then controlling them with a PID with the Phoenix6 libraries.

Open-loop (VoltageOutput) control of the motors seems to be working and now we’re looking at closed-loop control (VelocityVoltage).

Our motors are barely moving but they are getting very hot. We even popped one of the control boards earlier today.

With the Phoenix5 library we only needed to set Kp, Ki, and Kd. Now with Phoenix 6 it looks like Ks and Kv need to be set, otherwise the motors do not move at all. I’m confused about what Ks and Kv are supposed to be. Do they need to be set to use VelocityVoltage? Are we missing something else?

Thanks

Here’s a link to their docs about what Ks and Kv are.

Assuming you’re doing this for a shooter wheel or something that you are using for velocity control?

Here’s a bit of a discussion from yesterday that’s similar in nature (my own question being answered).

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-02-17T22:33:03.128Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":56,"readers_count":55,"score":21.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":455151,"topic_slug":"falcon-500-phoenix6-pid-not-working","display_username":"NewtonCrosby","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/talonfx-velocityvoltage-control-question-help/455012","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"TalonFX VelocityVoltage Control Question/Help","clicks":13},{"url":"https://v6.docs.ctr-electronics.com/en/2023-v6/docs/api-reference/device-specific/talonfx/closed-loop-requests.html#velocity-control","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Closed-Loop Control","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31346,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/falcon-500-phoenix6-pid-not-working/455151/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3312000,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-18T00:01:25.079Z","cooked":"

There’s a lot that can go wrong with the system so check it all carefully. Sensor phase should be the same as the motor phase, set invert trouble, incorrect or inconsistent units, values too high or low, seems like my team had a couple of other errors, … , use of some conversion factor screwed it up, too.

Values that work probably will come in around Kp = 0.3 volts/rps, Ki = 0., Kd = 0 or very small; Ks = 0.1 volts or 0; Kv = 0.1 volts / rps. Kv is optional but the PID controller usually settles way below the setpoint without that feed forward.
